Package api

Interface directed_weighted_graph

All Known Implementing Classes:
DWGraph_DS
public interface directed_weighted_graph
This interface represents a directional weighted graph. The interface has a road-system or communication network in mind - and support a large number of nodes (over 100,000). The implementation be based on an efficient compact representation (NOT be based on a n*n matrix).

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addNode​(node_data n)
    adds a new node to the graph with the given node_data.
    void connect​(int src, int dest, double w)
    Connects an edge with weight w between node src to node dest
    int edgeSize()
    Returns the number of edges (assume directional graph).
    java.util.Collection<edge_data> getE​(int node_id)
    This method returns a pointer (shallow copy) for the collection representing all the edges getting out of the given node (all the edges starting (source) at the given node).
    edge_data getEdge​(int src, int dest)
    returns the data of the edge (src,dest), null if none.
    int getMC()
    Returns the Mode Count - for testing changes in the graph.
    node_data getNode​(int key)
    returns the node_data by the node_id,
    java.util.Collection<node_data> getV()
    This method returns a pointer (shallow copy) for the collection representing all the nodes in the graph.
    int nodeSize()
    Returns the number of vertices (nodes) in the graph.
    edge_data removeEdge​(int src, int dest)
    Deletes the edge from the graph, Note: this method run in O(1) time.
    node_data removeNode​(int key)
    Deletes the node (with the given ID) from the graph - and removes all edges which starts or ends at this node.

  • Method Details

    • getNode

      node_data getNode​(int key)
      returns the node_data by the node_id,
      Parameters:
      key - - the node_id.
      Returns:
      the node_data by the node_id, null if none.

    • getEdge

      edge_data getEdge​(int src, int dest)
      returns the data of the edge (src,dest), null if none. Note: this method run in O(1) time.
      Parameters:
      src - - start node.
      dest - - end node.
      Returns:
      e - return the edge between src to dest.

    • addNode

      void addNode​(node_data n)
      adds a new node to the graph with the given node_data. Note: this method run in O(1) time.
      Parameters:
      n - - new node.

    • connect

      void connect​(int src, int dest, double w)
      Connects an edge with weight w between node src to node dest. * Note: this method run in O(1) time.
      Parameters:
      src - - the source of the edge.
      dest - - the destination of the edge.
      w - - positive weight representing the cost (aka time, price, etc) between src-->dest.

    • getV

      java.util.Collection<node_data> getV()
      This method returns a pointer (shallow copy) for the collection representing all the nodes in the graph. Note: this method run in O(1) time.
      Returns:
      Collection - all the vertex in the graph.

    • getE

      java.util.Collection<edge_data> getE​(int node_id)
      This method returns a pointer (shallow copy) for the collection representing all the edges getting out of the given node (all the edges starting (source) at the given node). Note: this method run in O(k) time, k being the collection size.
      Parameters:
      node_id - - id of the node.
      Returns:
      Collection - all the Neighbors by node id.

    • removeNode

      node_data removeNode​(int key)
      Deletes the node (with the given ID) from the graph - and removes all edges which starts or ends at this node. This method run in O(k), V.degree=k, as all the edges be removed.
      Parameters:
      key - - of the node.
      Returns:
      node - the data of the removed node (null if none).

    • removeEdge

      edge_data removeEdge​(int src, int dest)
      Deletes the edge from the graph, Note: this method run in O(1) time.
      Parameters:
      src - - id of src node.
      dest - - id of dest node.
      Returns:
      the data of the removed edge (null if none).

    • nodeSize

      int nodeSize()
      Returns the number of vertices (nodes) in the graph. Note: this method run in O(1) time.
      Returns:
      nodeSize - the number of the vertex in the graph.

    • edgeSize

      int edgeSize()
      Returns the number of edges (assume directional graph). Note: this method run in O(1) time.
      Returns:
      edgeSize - the number of the edges in the graph.

    • getMC

      int getMC()
      Returns the Mode Count - for testing changes in the graph.
      Returns:
      t - The amount of changes in the graph.
